intro: Nasturtium kouytchense, commonly known as the Andean watercress, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andes region of South America. It features heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are often submerged or floating in aquatic environments. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typical of the Tropaeolaceae family. Its leaves are edible and have a peppery, watercress-like flavor, making it a valued ingredient in local cuisines. Nasturtium kouytchense thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in streams and wetlands.
